The Tree Pose (Vrikshasana) is a yoga posture that can help improve balance, stability, and focus. Here are the steps to perform the Tree Pose:
Stand straight with your feet together and your arms by your sides. Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground. Bend your right knee and place the sole of your right foot on your left thigh. If this is too difficult, you can place your foot on your calf instead. Bring your hands together in front of your chest in a prayer position or lift them up above your head. Focus your gaze on a fixed point in front of you to help with balance. Hold the pose for 5-10 deep breaths. Release the pose by lowering your right foot to the ground and returning to the starting position. Repeat the pose on the other side, placing your left foot on your right thigh. Tips:
Try to keep your hips level and facing forward throughout the pose. Engage your core muscles to help with balance. If you find it difficult to balance, you can place your hand on a wall or chair for support. Avoid placing your foot on your knee, as this can cause strain on the joint.
